bill_title: Commending the 2009 Winner Warriors High School Football Team for winning the State 11B Championship.

bill_versions.bill_text: A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Commending the 2009 Winner Warriors High School Football Team for winning the State 11B Championship. WHEREAS, the Winner Warriors were led to victory under the exceptional leadership of head coach Dan Aaker and assistant coaches Derris Buus, Casey Vietor, Trent Olson, and Glenn Carlson; and WHEREAS, the Winner Warriors Football Team was exemplary in its remarkable esprit de corps and cohesion between each of the respective team members: Taylor Novotny, Tanner Fritz, JD Farley, Sam Aeschbacher, Jesse Docken, Adam Farner, Ted Wonnenberg, Kyle Bertram, Eric Schueth, Nathan Naasz, Kyle Mathis, Austin Richey, Jayd Knodell, Taylor Buus, Nolan Donahue, Dalton Daughters, Austin Calhoon, Cody Blare, Michael Hofeldt, Ben Connot, Tony Littau, Brandon Briggs, Jacob Naasz, Austin Moser, Taylor Haley, Logan Soles, Daniel Lauritsen, Kevin Kingsbury, Carson Covey, Jamie Halverson, Blake Burnham, Kyle Swedlund, Logan Boerner, Clint Carlson, Jayd Docken, Ryan Rowe, Alex Bachman, Taylor Assman, Grant Toman, Brandon Tuttle, Izak Nespor, Trevor Larson, Dylan Donahue, Tate Novotny, Tanner Moser, Zach Horstman, Austin Schroeder, Chance Littau, Tanner Best, and Isiah Old Lodge, and manager Eric Scott; and WHEREAS, the players and coaches showed unmatched dedication, focus, and determination by clinching the 11B championship with a game-winning, 47-yard pass on the final play, thus attaining a perfect 12-0 season; and WHEREAS, the staff, cheerleaders, students, faculty, fans, and community of Winner showed great spirit, sportsmanship, and support to the Warriors, all of which were invaluable to the success of the team and a testament to the character of South Dakota's high school athletics enthusiasts: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Eighty-fifth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that the Winner High School Football Team, coaches, and support staff be congratulated and commended for their outstanding accomplishments in the 2009 season.

A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Commending the 2009 Winner Warriors High School Football Team for winning the State 11B Championship. WHEREAS, the Winner Warriors were led to victory under the exceptional leadership of head coach Dan Aaker and assistant coaches Derris Buus, Casey Vietor, Trent Olson, and Glenn Carlson; and WHEREAS, the Winner Warriors Football Team was exemplary in its remarkable esprit de corps and cohesion between each of the respective team members: Taylor Novotny, Tanner Fritz, JD Farley, Sam Aeschbacher, Jesse Docken, Adam Farner, Ted Wonnenberg, Kyle Bertram, Eric Schueth, Nathan Naasz, Kyle Mathis, Austin Richey, Jayd Knodell, Taylor Buus, Nolan Donahue, Dalton Daughters, Austin Calhoon, Cody Blare, Michael Hofeldt, Ben Connot, Tony Littau, Brandon Briggs, Jacob Naasz, Austin Moser, Taylor Haley, Logan Soles, Daniel Lauritsen, Kevin Kingsbury, Carson Covey, Jamie Halverson, Blake Burnham, Kyle Swedlund, Logan Boerner, Clint Carlson, Jayd Docken, Ryan Rowe, Alex Bachman, Taylor Assman, Grant Toman, Brandon Tuttle, Izak Nespor, Trevor Larson, Dylan Donahue, Tate Novotny, Tanner Moser, Zach Horstman, Austin Schroeder, Chance Littau, Tanner Best, and Isiah Old Lodge, and manager Eric Scott; and WHEREAS, the players and coaches showed unmatched dedication, focus, and determination by clinching the 11B championship with a game-winning, 47-yard pass on the final play, thus attaining a perfect 12-0 season; and WHEREAS, the staff, cheerleaders, students, faculty, fans, and community of Winner showed great spirit, sportsmanship, and support to the Warriors, all of which were invaluable to the success of the team and a testament to the character of South Dakota's high school athletics enthusiasts: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Eighty-fifth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that the Winner High School Football Team, coaches, and support staff be congratulated and commended for their outstanding accomplishments in the 2009 season.
